meanings.definition: Gadroons (noun): A decorative motif consisting of a series of convex curves.
meanings.sent1: The antique vase was adorned with intricate gadroons along its base.
meanings.sent2: The jewelry box featured delicate gadroons that added elegance to its design.
meanings.sent3: The cake decorator playfully added gadroons made of frosting on top of the birthday cake.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter echoed through the room, bouncing off the gadroons of the decorative mirror.
meanings.sent5: The artist meticulously carved gadroons into the wooden frame, creating a stunning masterpiece.

meanings.definition: Gadroons (verb): To decorate with a series of convex curves.
meanings.sent1: She decided to gadroon the edges of the table to give it a more elegant look.
meanings.sent2: The craftsman carefully gadrooned the metal frame of the mirror to enhance its beauty.
meanings.sent3: The chef playfully gadrooned the plate with chocolate sauce, creating a fancy presentation.
meanings.sent4: His words gadrooned the story with vivid descriptions, bringing it to life for the listeners.
meanings.sent5: The gardener gadrooned the pathway with colorful flowers, making it a delightful walkway.
